title: Medical Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: 3 stage interview process. All interviews were conducted over zoom in result of the pandemic. Majority of the interview questions were based on hypothetical situations, problem solving, and customer service when interacting with patients.
Interview Questions: How would you interact with a patient that has an invisible disability?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: The interview took place virtually with the volunteer coordinator. The interview went very smoothly and the interviewer was very supportive and encouraging. It was a great experience and I definitely recommend working here.
Interview Questions: Scenario questions (like what would you do if this happened)

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sinai Health
Interview Descriptions: I got an in person interview. Meet by unit manager, nurse educator and one of the staff nurse . Take roughly 30min for the interview. Questions are general, as long as prepared, no hard to answer.
Interview Questions: 1. introduction question: tell me able youself and career goal 2. how you deal with conflict 3. scenarios question

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sinai Health
Interview Descriptions: There were two interviewers in a panel interview format, and asked very specific questions pertaining to the role I applied for. The whole process including reference checks took probably a month.
Interview Questions: what is your biggest weakness

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Sinai Health
Interview Descriptions: It was a video interview. It was conducted fairly well, the interviewers were polite but professional. They asked multiple questions regarding my own aspirations and what I can provide in the setup. No mention of salary range or budget, though.
Interview Questions: What obstacle have you faced at your previous workplace and how did you deal with it?

title: Ward Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received call to interview with nurse manager around 2 weeks later. Interview consisted with a series of pre set behavioural questions, interview lasted around 30 minutes. Currently awaits reply for further action.
Interview Questions: Tell me a time when you worked under very stressful situation and how did you deal with it.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Oct 2022
Interview Descriptions: It was a one-hour interview where they described what projects were being conducted and what I would be doing, asked questions about my experiences, and at the end I had the opportunity to ask questions.
Interview Questions: Please describe your research experiences

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Was interviewed by two people, and the process took one week. The process went from applying, waiting a week for a reply, to the set up of an interview, and after I was offered the position 2 days via email from when I first did the interview. The interview took 30 minutes and was asked general questions, more so a casual conversation about scenerios, experience and goals.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself? 

How would you deal with conflict? 

How do you time manage, give an example? 

Give an example when you went above and beyond what was asked of you.

Weakness? Strengths?

title: ED RN Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sinai Health
Interview Descriptions: Had a zoom panel interview with  manager and clinical coordinator. There were some personal scenario/behavioural questions, along with clinical questions relevant to emergency nursing. Heard back via email within a few days.
Interview Questions: A patient comes in with alerted level of consciousness. What are your nursing actions?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sinai Health
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was comprehensive and required the candidate to summarize the actions they will take to provide patient care in a variety of scenarios. The interviewer additionally reviewed the job description and FTE commitments wit hthe candidate.
Interview Questions: What would you do if (insert scenario here)?

title: Research Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied to their website, the interview was booked within a week through my email. After a couple of weeks, I received a rejection email. The interview was done with 2 interviewers Asked hard questions, 30 minutes of duration
Interview Questions: I was asked about what I would do to protect patients' identity The job was to handle email and things for the researchers

title: Clinical Research Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Sinai Health
Interview Descriptions: Very polite and kind interview. Very role-specific questions were asked. The interviewer was very honest regarding the position's roles and responsibilities. It was like having a nice conversation. Zero intimidation
Interview Questions: Past experience in clinical research and telephonic interviews

title: RPN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: Applied online. Got a call to set up an interview almost two weeks after the deadline of the job posting. Interview was online the following week. About a 30 min interview with the nurse educator and manager of the unit
Interview Questions:
unwitnessed patient fall, what would you assess for? 
Head-to-toe assessment questions. Trach and G-tube assessments. 
Discuss a time you provided therapeutic care to a patient.
Discuss a time you had a conflict with a co-worker

title: Clinical Extern (Student Nurse) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: The interview was online. There were 2 recruiters who conducted the interview. Lasted approximately 10-15 minutes. They follow up with you by email and phone. They also asked me during the interview about my preferences and what unit/field I was interested in working. They also ask about your availability during the interview. It took approximately a week to hear back from them and get started with orientation.
Interview Questions:
1. What projects have you completed in nursing school that relate to your interest in the field you selected?
2. What is your role as an unregulated care provider?
3. Describe a time when you encountered a conflict with a staff member.
4. Why are you good for this position/why should we hire you? 
5. What is one of your weaknesses?
6. Scenario questions - the patient is short of breath, what do you do?  Nurse asks you to hang an antibiotic bag, what do you do? The patient is at risk for falls/cognitively impaired, how can you reduce risk of injury?

title: Research Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview with scientist and manager. Questions are straightforward and people are friendly. Scientist can tell you if they like you and want you right away. Only one round of interview
Interview Questions: What skills you think you have that are applicable to this position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was good, but I was an internal hire so there was a little less formal structure. I met with the manager and educator. It lasted about 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: Describe a time you dealt with a difficult patient or family member

title: Intake Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone interview was done, then a virtual Interview with standard with some scenario questions, done with 3 people. There was a series of questions about skill, prioritizing etc. I was never contacted after the interview with an answer
Interview Questions: How you would prioritize a list of different tasks

title: Cook Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online and was contacted by HR about two weeks after to schedule an interview with the hiring managers. My appointment was scheduled at 1pm and I was told to go to the HR office. I arrived about 10 minutes early only to realize that the HR office was closed as the employees were on lunch break. The office opened about 5 minutes after 1pm and the HR representative called the managers to let them know I was there.

The interview was pretty standard - mostly scripted behavioral questions. The interviewers seemed very inexperienced hiring. The hiring manager told me that HR would let me know the results - they needed the position to be filled pretty soon.

One week passed with no communication so I sent a follow-up letter to HR. I was told that they were still interviewing candidates and that I would get an answer either way. It has now been over a month - no one bothered to get back to me.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to work on a team project and you didn't get along with one of the members.

title: Information Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online.  Was given a telephone screening interview. Then interviewed at the hospital. They told me that I was the "preferred candidate" and then advised me after I turned down another opportunity that the job was given to someone else.  I will never believe anything I hear from these people ever!
Interview Questions: Give an example of when you had a conflict with a co-worker, how was it resolved and what did you learn?

title: Administrative Staff Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Dec 2018
Interview Descriptions:
I was applying for a position that I was told was part of a new department (they had no support staff whatsoever).  

Initial phone interview and then invited to do an online test.  The online test took hours to complete and had to be broken up into 2 days. 

The in-person interview took approximately an hour.  The interviewer was very friendly.  I was led to believe that the position was most likely mine, and to be patient with HR processes. 

After 2 weeks and no contact from HR, I reached out to inquire. Waited another 2 weeks and inquired again to be told the position was on "hold" until further notice.  

Very disappointing and time consuming experience from a candidate perspective.  I suspect that the position was not really available and they were testing to see what was out there.
Interview Questions: Give an example of a time you went above and beyond for a client

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: short (~15min). The decision may have already been made based on the applications. Was surprised by the large number of interviewees. Candidates with diverse backgrounds. Post interview, reference letters were requested.
Interview Questions: general inquires: the five Ws and How type of questions

title: Abilities Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: Ridiculous! I did a phone interview with HR first then an in person interview with Manager and Team .I was called the very next day saying they wanted me  and HR said congratulations we just need to have the health screening done and references checked. Got a call the next week "Oh we have to advertise this job internally so you will have to reapply when it is posted again" Really? What kind of incompetence is that? I asked why I was no longer being considered after I reapplied  and HR did not even have the decency to answer me. Some people should not have these jobs and I was treated unfairly. It now appears they are still advertising this position.
Interview Questions: Why should we hire you?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sinai Health
Interview Descriptions: Traditional questions, have to have updated flu shots, background checks, one on one interview with the manager, asks generic questions related to field of study or employment. Friendly staff and great interview experience
Interview Questions: Asked about familiarity with medical terminology, previous experience in clinical or research position, etc.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and got a call to set up an interview about a week later. Scheduled one in-person interview within 2 days of call to set one up. Interview was with 4 people (unit manager and others - don't remember their roles). They asked for references the following day.
Interview did not start on time.
Interview Questions:
Questions on conflict with colleagues, not so many questions on unit specific things

Explain your resume and career goals, and how this job will help you reach your goals 
What is professional practice (provide qualities)
Example of how you provided exceptional care
How to confront a colleague that needs to improve 
An argument/conflict you had with another nurse 
Your definition of family-centered care 
Physician not responding to your concerns of a patient, what do you do?

Unit specific focused assessments/actions: early labour, breastfeeding, perinatal loss

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Sinai Health
Interview Descriptions: 3 people interviewed you, they asked many case scenario questions with behavioural question plus why you want to work with us. In the last stage, they gave a paper for the case scenario related to prioritization.
Interview Questions: how are you going to give a feedback to coworker?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sinai Health in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: After submitting an online application, there was a telephone screening interview, which was followed by a panel interview. The panel included the director, manager and researcher for the position, as well as a HR representative and another program staff.
Interview Questions: Behavioural as well as skills

title: Occupational Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was scheduled for an in-person interview about 2 weeks later. There were 2 interviewers and both were very friendly. They asked standard interview questions (e.g., what are your strengths and weaknesses), behaviour based questions (e.g., tell me about a time when you resolved a conflict), and 2-3 scenario questions (e.g., how would you treat a client who had a stroke?). The interview took 40-50 minutes and there was an opportunity to ask questions at the end. The HR worker emailed all candidates about the decision 2 weeks later.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a successful team you've worked with in the past and describe the qualities that make a good team.

title: Human Resources Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Dec 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I applied through an agency and was told to go to the Toronto location for an in-person interview with the HR manager.
I got there and there was the HR manager and another employee there to interview me.
Interview Questions:
1. Tell me about yourself?
2. How will you handle an angry client?
3. What are your future goals for 2017?
4. Are you someone that prefers working as an individual or in a team?
5. There were a lot of questions related to my experience (as stated in my resume)

I think the interview process was okay and they were friendly.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and interviewed at the hospital in the manager's room. the interview took about 30 minutes. charge nurse and CNS were also in the interview. the interview was harder compared to other interviews that I had in other hospitals. most questions were specific nursing skills and medications. there were questions about lab values and medications.
Interview Questions: Most were related to the unit and were specific. harder than other interviews

title: PSw Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Very friendly,warm environment 
All staff polite as well as welcoming 
Effective. Organized
Interview was very precise and explanatory
I felt like ya this is where I want to be 
Where I can really use my skills
And feel appreciated for my work
Interview Questions:
Where u went to school
Future expectations as well as goals

title: Medical Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Sinai Health in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Was called for a 2nd interview after doing a test. I got an email that I passed and I got a panel interview. I followed up a week later, first by email then I called 3 days after the email to learn that I was not chosen. They could have at least lessen my anxiety by just replying to my email instead of me waiting the whole weekend.
Interview Questions: Why are you applying for this position?

title: Personal Support Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions:
You get a situation question 
Ask about what type of people your worked with or tools your work with. 
The staff get most of the information over the phone they asked me to do a test where I was given 3 people address name and phone number and I had to write the information done.  But they going to a cell phone/web page.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with a life befor?

title: Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: We’re two stages, first with the hr by phone+ in person and second with the manager, simple questions, high expectations from the candidate in terms of number of skills for an entry level position
Interview Questions: Why did you apply? Tell us about the tools that you use for the professional development?

title: Medical Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: After applying for several hospital positions, I finally received a reply. The interview itself was comfortable enough for me to answer the questions accurate with the physician and Human resources present. I then had to do a skills test on Microsoft office and typing speed/accuracy. It was a great experience for me.
Interview Questions: What would I do if a family member called for results on a patient's behalf?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Manager called for an interview a week after I applied. Initial phone screening questions, followed by an in person interview a few days later. The interview was very easy going. The emphasis was on ensuring you had the right experience for the job.
Interview Questions: Do you experience recruiting participants into a research study?

title: MBA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: 2 Rounds of interviews, first was phone screening with HR with basic questions such as why I wanted to work for Mount Sinai. They asked me to bring in a writing sample of my choice for second round interview. Second round was half an hour behavioral with same HR, senior consultant in organizational development and a past MBA intern who currently works at the hospital.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a leadership experience in which you had to convince someone to change their views.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Sinai Health
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to come in for an interview via email.  I was given a date and time and asked whether or not that worked.  Some general questions were asked; nursing skills, tell me a bit about yourself, are you involved in any organizations, where do you see yourself in 5 years etc.  After that, there were case based questions with scenarios, these were a bit difficult.  The interviewers explained the position in more detail and asked if i had any questions.  I was hired on the spot and emailed an offer of acceptance.
Interview Questions: Give us an example of a time when you went above and beyond for your patient.

title: Postdoctoral Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Sinai Health (Toronto, ON)
Interview Descriptions: submit a CV to a prinicpal investigator followed by an interview from the primary investigator and perhaps other members of the lab
Interview Questions: none
